FuncDef:
The active port-evpn command activates EVPN interface licenses for a board in batches.
The undo active port-evpn command deactivates EVPN interface licenses for a board in batches.
By default, EVPN interface licenses are not activated for a board.
CLIs: undo active port-evpn slot <slotid> card <cardid> [ port <portlist> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a subcard ID.
The value is an integer. The value depends on the subcard status on the device.

Specifies the interface list of a board, with the interfaces separated by commas (,) or hyphens (-).
The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the slot ID of a board.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-license] undo active port-evpn slot 1 card 0 port 0-8
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The EVPN service can be configured on a board only after EVPN interface licenses are activated for the board.
Prerequisites
The license file for the master control board has been activated using the license active command.The interface-specific basic hardware licenses for the board have been activated in batches using the active port-basic slot card port command.

Precautions
This command applies only to the Admin-VS.
